text: oh hi everyone corinthany Cobb Tano here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review this new Jessie
Ware album that feels good this is the
fifth full length LP from pop singer and
songwriter Jesse Ware back with a
follow-up to her surprise smash record
what's your pleasure my 2020 album of
the year and one of her most successful
releases to date so successful it made
her reconsider hanging up the microphone
for good which he discussed in a recent
interview we had so why did what's your
pleasure stir up the commotion that it
did first off it was a pretty bold
change in styles from Jessie's last
three records which dabbled mostly in
pop soul and very smooth and elegant r b
and Jesse is also no stranger to dance
music of course with her vocals having
been featured on many an electronic cut
and DJ Mix but the groove she was going
for on what's your pleasure were much
more vintage by Nature we're talking old
school synth Funk electrodisco Boogie
freestyle synth pop to a real gamut of
classic styles that culminated in a fun
sexy catchy Dance Odyssey that for sure
was nostalgic but had a modern punch to
it too plus the production was fantastic
the songwriting was on point two the
Stars really aligned on this project now
considering what a watershed moment this
record was for Jesse what choice did she
have other than to give the fans more
with a deluxe edition of the album that
had some great extra tracks and now that
feels good which is very clearly related
to its predecessor based off title alone
as it kind of answers what's your
pleasure's question and this project
sounds like a sister record too as the
sonics of this thing still sit pretty
tightly in the realm of disco and old
school dance music but this time Miss
Ware and her collaborators are treating
us to something that is a lot Bolder
brighter tighter especially since this
is a shorter record in terms of tracks
and run time just by a little bit but
what this thing doesn't have in
expansive and hypnotic dance passages it
makes up for in punch which is Apparent
from the opening title track that kicks
things off with a lot of sensual vocal
layers repeating the song title and a
hard bunk bass line that locks it in
very nicely with the drums there are
some spicy hot horn sections swelling
into the mix here and there too from the
first beats to the Epic bridge to the uh
kind of sassy group vocal Passages at
the very end the song is a Non-Stop
party really an Anthem for letting the
intrusive thoughts win the following
track Free Yourself by comparison is
more of a purist's disco Anthem even if
the beats are a bit punchier than the
classic stuff and some of the
transitions from point to point in the
song uh resemble that of like a house
cut once again Jesse and her
collaborators kind of nail that balance
between uh sounding old but sounding new
doing so with thumping kicks and soaring
lead vocals and bright string hits the
whole thing sounds so cinematic I feel
like I'm in a movie just listening to it
then pearls is another very ornately
arranged dance rager but this time I
would say a bit more cheeky not just in
terms of the more playful grooves and
everything but also lyrics that talk
about dancing to the point where uh
pearls or some bits of jewelry on you
are just falling off which is clever a
little silly but it's really miss Ware's
killer vocal performance that kind of
dominates on this one especially as she
hits those high notes on Lost in Romance
Let's Just Dance okay let me try to do
it
so I cannot I cannot hit those notes
which is one of a few really good
melodic ideas flying at you all at once
on the track be it the shouty shake it
till the purse fall off for friends or
the la la la la la la la la like if one
of those little hooks doesn't grab you
the other two will hello love is a great
cool down Moment On The Record more of a
ballad one that is a vintage piece of
string kissed Soul kind of a groovy beat
on the back end with lyrics about
running into a former lover and kind of
Catching Feelings all over again there
are some clever pieces of wordplay in
the lyrics too like I thought tonight
would just be me myself and eyeing the
tracks classy refined sweet well-written
love it but then begin again which was
another single from the album is really
like the anthem of the record the beat
on this one moves with a purpose once
again the instrumentation sounding
cinematic as hell you also have these
chromatic descending lines that have
kind of a sour tone to them and feel a
bit Latin too plus the biggest display
of strings horns and group vocals the
track sounds Larger than Life but the
lyrics are based on some very simple
asks with Jesse talking about having
progressed to a point where she's
working too much or how the current
state of love sees affection being
filtered through machines and she
laments the direction things have moved
in and wishes to begin again go back to
the start it's a high water mark on the
album in my opinion one that the record
never quite reaches again not just in
terms of messaging but also instrumental
display which could just be a sequencing
issue or the record offering too much
too early because things do kind of
Coast down from here in my opinion but
not too much I am a little torn on the
funk instrumentation and silly spoken
word passages on beautiful people there
are some notes of sadness in the lyrics
but the track mostly seems to be an
Embrace of being happy being positive
the song does hit a stride around the
midpoint but I do think the first leg of
it sounds a little bit like I don't know
an advertisement for luxury clothing or
hard liquor and I'm not entirely sold on
it freak me now though sees Jesse and
her collaborators making a classic 90s
house Bop with the shouty diva vocals
and everything which is a surprising
switch up given the Aesthetics of the
record so far but I would say the vibe
is nailed perfectly the kicks go hard
the synth bass is insanely thick the
lyrics mentioned being heated up cooled
down freaked not exactly a refreshing
spin on this style but I feel like it's
done so well it could potentially go Toe
to Toe of some of the best tracks from
back in the day then shake the bottle as
another cut I'm a bit torn on as I think
the hook is slightly tacky the innuendo
of it I I think is just two on the nose
but with that being said I do love the
quirky Electronics hanging in the
background on the verses and the
theatrical bits of Storytelling and
sound play that kind of tell us all
about these various lovers Jesse is
talking about on the song it's just
super creative and reminds me of like
some obscure Electro and Club gems from
the late 70s and early 80s then from
here we have an oak okay ending on the
lp lightning is another low-key and
sensual moment on the record this time
giving us a very synthetic chill piece
of Pop soul that for sure is out of step
with everything on the album thus far
but I guess feels like kind of a
throwback to something from Jessie's
first three records maybe long time fans
of Jesse will be more thrilled than me
to hear her kind of touch back on this
then there's these lips which I do think
ties things up nicely in a big groovy
sexy bow the huge string sections and
vocal harmonies are back there are some
Stellar tumbling horn lines on the song
that kind of transition us from one
point to another and the song
essentially serves as the Supreme
Ode to sensuality and touch which for a
record like this is a pretty valid way
to bow out I will say I loved this album
overall I think it's great a lot of Bops
on it but I will say I did not find this
record to be as consistent or as
thorough in terms of exploring its
Aesthetics and its theme as its
predecessor and while for sure this
album is is its own record and can be
enjoyed in in a vacuum in a way it does
feel a little bit like a very long
epilogue post what's your pleasure All
Things Considered on this album I'm
feeling a decent eight on it transition

you love it did you hate it but would
